mdRecord.dcterms:title: Tannery, exterior|general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: This building is likely the one shown on the 1820 map of Hancock Shaker Village as a Cider House. In 1835 it was enlarged to replace an earlier tannery and probably set on a one-story stone foundation. A date stone reading 1835 is set into the outside of the northeast corner foundation wall. -- https://hancockshakervillage.org/shakers/museum/historic-architecture/tannery/ [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
religious communities (built complexes)
Shaker (Christian sect)
factories (structures)
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: 1843 West Housatonic Street, Pittsfield, Berkshire, Massachusetts, United States
